skill.name: using-git-worktrees
skill.description: Use when starting feature work that needs isolation from current workspace or before executing implementation plans - creates isolated git worktrees with smart directory selection and safety verification
skill.summary: Use when starting feature work that needs isolation from current workspace or before executing imple...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Prompt-based skill with pure instructions. Uses standard git commands for worktree creation. No executable code, no network access, no sensitive data exposure. All capabilities align with stated purpose of creating isolated git workspaces.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple features in the same repository requires constant branch switching and context loss. This skill creates isolated git worktrees that let you work on separate features simultaneously with automatic directory selection, safety verification, and clean baseline testing.
actual_capabilities: Create isolated git worktrees in project-local or global directories
Auto-detect existing worktree directories and project preferences
Verify .gitignore safety before creating project-local worktrees
Auto-detect project type and run appropriate setup commands
Verify clean test baseline before starting feature work
Follow directory priority: existing > CLAUDE.md > user preference
limitations: Requires existing git repository with write access
Does not manage worktree cleanup (pairs with finishing-a-development-branch skill)
Cannot create worktrees for bare repositories
Does not handle worktree conflicts or stale lock files

use_cases.title: Parallel Feature Development
use_cases.description: Work on multiple features simultaneously by creating isolated worktrees without switching branches or losing context

use_cases.title: Safe Review Environment
use_cases.description: Create isolated worktrees to test pull requests without affecting your current development state

use_cases.title: Isolated Bug Investigation
use_cases.description: Create separate worktrees for investigating different bugs without cross-contamination of fixes

prompt_templates.title: Start Feature Work
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the using-git-worktrees skill to create an isolated workspace for implementing the new authentication feature.

prompt_templates.title: Set Up Review Environment
prompt_templates.prompt: Use using-git-worktrees to create a worktree for reviewing this pull request. Check for existing worktree directory first.

prompt_templates.title: Parallel Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use using-git-worktrees to create an isolated worktree for the performance bug. Use the global directory option.

prompt_templates.title: Auto-Detect Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Run using-git-worktrees for the feature branch. Let it auto-detect the project type and run appropriate setup commands.

output_examples.input: Use using-git-worktrees to create an isolated workspace for the payment integration feature.
output: Ready to implement payment integration feature

best_practices: Always verify .gitignore contains worktree directory before creating project-local worktrees
Follow directory priority: existing directories > CLAUDE.md preferences > user prompts
Run test baseline to ensure clean state before starting feature work
anti_patterns: Creating worktrees without running baseline tests first
Assuming directory location without checking CLAUDE.md or existing directories

faq.question: Does this skill work with any git hosting service?
faq.answer: Yes. Git worktrees are a local git feature that works with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and self-hosted git servers.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of worktrees I can create?
faq.answer: Git does not limit worktree count. Practical limits depend on disk space and system resources for each workspace.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with git submodules?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works with repositories containing submodules. Worktrees share the parent repository configuration.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using global worktree directories?
faq.answer: Yes. Global directories (~/.config/superpowers/worktrees) are outside the project and never committed accidentally.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail during baseline verification?
faq.answer: The skill reports test failures and asks whether to proceed or investigate before making changes.

faq.question: How does this compare to git stash for isolation?
faq.answer: Worktrees provide full isolated directories with separate working states. Stash only saves changes temporarily without workspace isolation.
